title: Business Live: Oil prices unsettled - BBC News
summary: average earnings rise 2.1 % in year to august .

documents.title: good night
text: thank you for joining business live .
we 'll be back on thursday from 6.00am with all the breaking business and economics news and comment throughout the day .

documents.title: ebay sees revenues jump
text: ebay has just reported an 8.7 % increase in quarterly revenue as revamps to its e-commerce platforms helped attract more customers .
the online auction site 's net income rose to $ 523m , or 48 cents per share , in the third quarter ended 30 september , from $ 413m , or 36 cents per share , a year earlier .
revenue rose to $ 2.41bn from $ 2.22bn .

documents.title: american express sees profit jump
text: credit card issuer american express has just reported a 19 % jump in quarterly profit as higher billings and loan growth helped offset a jump in costs .
net income rose to $ 1.36bn , or $ 1.50 per share , in the third quarter ended 30 september from $ 1.14bn , or $ 1.20 per share , a year earlier .
total revenue rose 9 % to $ 8.44bn .

documents.title: dow ends above 23,000
text: the dow has ended over 23,000 points for the first time following strong earnings from ibm that boosted confidence about the rest of the quarterly reporting season .
at the end of the trading session , the dow jones industrial average stood at 23,156.84 , up 0.7 % .
the s & p 500 rose to 2,561.25 , while the nasdaq edged up to 6,624.22 .
both the s & p 500 and nasdaq were also at records at the closing bell .

documents.title: watch : xi jinping 's progress
text: china 's president xi jinping will be confirmed for a second five-year term this month .
robin brant asks what he has delivered so far on key areas like the environment , debt and market reform .

documents.title: budget sneak preview
text: a photographer has managed to secure a snap of an `` unknown '' official entering downing street with some budget proposals .
the partially obscured document suggest plans to raise the income tax threshold may be put on hold .
the conservatives promised in their manifesto to raise the income tax threshold to £ 12,500 by 2020 , up from its current rate of £ 11,500 .
they have also promised to increase to £ 50,000 the point at which people begin paying the higher 40p tax rate by 2020 , up from £ 45,000 now .

one option which appears to be on the snapped paper would be to meet the 2020 manifesto commitment but then to pre-announce a freeze thereafter until the end of the parliament in 2022 , according to the financial times .
the treasury has refused to comment .

documents.title: trump to name fed chair soon
text: white house press secretary sarah huckabee sanders has confirmed that the chair of the federal reserve will be named in the coming days .

the current chair janet yellen is believed to be part of a shortlist of five which is also understood to include : gary cohn , director of the national economic council and chief economic advisor to us president donald trump ; stanford university economics professor john taylor ; former fed board member kevin warsh and current member jerome powell .
mr trump is expected to name his in early november .

documents.title: ford recalls trucks in the us
text: ford has announced that it is recalling 1.3 million vehicles in the us .
the car-maker is calling in 2015-17 ford f-150 and 2017 ford super duty trucks to add water shields to side door latches .
it will cost the business $ 267m which will reflected in its fourth quarter results .
ford said it was not aware of any accidents or injuries associated with the issue but said because of the fault , the door may appear closed , increasing the risk of the door opening while driving .

documents.title: eu bill 'wo n't be debated this month '
text: eu bill 'wo n't be debated this month '

documents.title: oil prices edge higher
text: oil prices have clawed back a little ground .
brent crude is now up 0.4 % to $ 58.11 a barrel .
west texas intermediate is also ahead 0.4 % at $ 52.07 a barrel .
despite unsettled trading on wednesday , oil prices have been strong so far this week after iraqi forces retook the multi-ethnic city of kirkuk and its oilfields .
crude oil travels through a pipeline between iraq and turkey .

analysts at commerzbank , said : `` it remains to be seen whether the kurds , after withdrawing from the region they claim to be entitled to , will allow crude oil to be transported by pipeline across their territory to the turkish mediterranean port of ceyhan . ''

documents.title: youtube star attacks site 's leaders
text: one of youtube 's most influential vloggers has attacked the service 's leaders , claiming they are failing many of their most popular video creators .
specifically , casey neistat criticised the way the platform had made it impossible for some videos to generate advertising revenue , without clearly explaining the rules to its community .
one of his own videos - an interview with indonesia 's president - was temporarily `` demonetised '' last week .
read the story here .

documents.title: do n't expect brexit breakthrough , warns tusk
text: european council president donald tusk has warned the uk not to expect a `` breakthrough '' on brexit talks at a summit in brussels this week .
eu leaders will meet on thursday and friday .
mr tusk said : `` i do n't expect any kind of breakthrough tomorrow .
we have to work really hard in between october and december to finalise this so-called first phase and to start our negotiations on our future relations with the uk .
`` i am absolutely sure that it 's still possible to achieve this final of first phase in december but for this we need more concrete proposals from the british side to be honest . ''

documents.title: nations can deliver on nafta , says ups boss
text: mexico , canada and the us expect talks about nafta to extend into 2018 .
the boss of delivery giant ups is hopeful the three nation can reach an agreement .

chairman and chief executive david abney tells reuters : `` i 'm still optimistic , but i think we 're going to have to go through some difficult times just because each of the countries has issues specific to them . ''
he adds : not having a free trade agreement would not be something we feel anyone would benefit from . ''

documents.title: stock market rally continues for now
text: the dow jones industrial average is trading comfortably above the 23,000 mark .
it has added 156.05 points to 23,153.49 .
the s & p 500 has gained 3.37 points to 2,562.73 and the nasdaq is ahead 8.76 points at 6,632.42 .

omar aguilar , chief investment officer for equities at charles schwab investment management , says : `` we continue to see solid numbers above expectations , stability in terms of economic growth and global growth .
`` announcements by the ecb next week and decision by the fed in december will probably have a higher impact on whether or not we continue this rally . ''

documents.title: danone chairman to step down
text: the chairman of french food giant danone is stepping down .
franck riboud , the son of antoine riboud who founded danone in 1972 , will be replaced with chief executive emmanuel faber who will fill both roles at the company .
the change comes into effect in december .
mr riboud , 61 , will become honorary chairman .

documents.title: uk firms bid to build warships
text: bae systems and cammell laird to bid for type 31 frigate contract
@ twitterid
lets 's hope the french , germans or italians do n't get it .
a good partnership .
let 's get the navy back on track .
this should only be the start .

documents.title: watch : just 19 and loaded
text: akshay ruparelia set up an online estate agent while he was studying for his a-levels .
the company , doorsteps.co.uk , is now valued at £ 12m and is the 18th biggest estate agent in the uk .

documents.title: london stock markets close up
text: the ftse 100 closed up 26.70 at 7,542.87 .
education and publishing group pearson led the risers , up 3 % at 687p .
pharmaceutical group shire was the biggest faller , down 3.11 % to £ 37.19 .

rio tinto also dropped in value on wednesday , when its share price fell 2.98 % to £ 35.99 after it emerged that the mining giant and two of its former senior executives have been charged with fraud in the us .
shares in consumer product giant reckitt benckiser also fell , down 2.53 % to $ 68.57 after it cut its full-year revenue growth forecasts for a second time this year .
the ftse 250 closed up 128.82 at 20,259.77 .

documents.title: oil prices retreat
text: oil prices have retreated following higher than expected inventories of crude in the us .
brent crude has fallen back to its opening price of $ 57.89 after rising earlier on wednesday .
west texas intermediate is off 0.1 % at $ 51.83 a barrel following similar gains on wednesday .

data from the us energy information administration showed that although oil production fell last week after hurricane nate hit the gulf of mexico and refining slowed because of maintenance , stocks of gasoline , heating oil and diesel rose .
crude inventories fell 5.7 million barrels in the week to 13 october
distillate stockpiles , which include diesel and heating oil , rose 528,000 barrels compared to forecasts of a 1.5 million-barrel drop .
gasoline inventories increased by 908,000 barrels , ahead of an expected 256,000 barrel gain .

documents.title: pilots suspended over fancy farewell
text: air berlin has suspended the pilots of a plane that performed a fly-past to mark the insolvent airline 's last long-haul flight to an airport in duesseldorf .
according to reports , on monday the a330 jet flew low across the runway , then pulled up and banked sharply to the left before landing on its second approach .
one of the pilots told german broadcaster zdf : `` we wanted to make a mark , a dignified and emotional goodbye . ''
but a spokesman for air berlin , said : `` in aviation , safety always comes first .
we are taking the incident very seriously . ''

documents.title: why eu withdrawal bill 'delay ' matters
text: why eu withdrawal bill 'delay ' matters
author: Laura Kuenssberg
Political editor

documents.title: switzerland to share tax information
text: switzerland will start sharing information on multinationals operating in the region with other countries in 2020 .
the move is part of an international push to clamp down on tax evasion .
some 200 large companies who have operations in switzerland will have to draw up country-by-country reports which will show where they are generating revenue and where they are paying taxes .
european union members and japan have already agreed to start sharing information two years earlier from 2018 .

documents.title: travel operators add flights
text: travel operator tui says that it will put on extra flights to make up for the collapse of monarch airlines earlier this month .
tui 's uk and ireland managing director nick longman , says : `` there will be an opportunity to look at putting some new routes on to the market .
we 've already done that a little for this winter . ''
thomas cook tells reuters that it is also adding capacity , starting flights from leeds bradford airport and increasing capacity at luton to add a total of 230,000 seats for next summer .

documents.title: watch out for blocked drain scam
text: householders warned about 'blocked drain fraud '

documents.title: lloyds investors were 'mugged '
text: shareholders in lloyds were `` mugged '' when the bank decided to buy hbos without disclosing the parlous health of the ailing lender , the high court has heard .
richard hill qc , who made the remarks , is representing nearly 6,000 shareholders who are suing lloyds for £ 550m .
at the start of a 14-week trial , mr hill told mr justice norris : `` they should never have been kept in the dark and the responsibility for that lies fairly and squarely with the defendants . ''
he described the takeover in january 2009 as `` rushed '' and said documents sent to shareholders about the deal were `` highly misleading '' .
mr hill said :
the information that would have disclosed it was a bust failed bank was omitted deliberately .
the opposite impression was given .
so , although it had reached the same situation as northern rock , shareholders were not told that .
lloyds was later forced to take a government bailout of £ 20bn which gave the state a 43 % stake in the bank .
the government sold its last shares in lloyds earlier this year .
a spokesman for lloyds , says : `` the group 's position remains that we do not consider there to be any merit to these claims and we will robustly contest this legal action . ''

documents.title: big bounce for big blue
text: investors clearly liked what they saw in ibm 's third quarter results .
the us technology company 's share price is ahead 7.55 % at $ 157.61 in early trading , leading the dow jones industrial average risers .
the departure of amazon 's studio boss amid sexual harassment allegations failed to rattle markets .
its share price is off 2.57 points .

documents.title: staveley in the running for newcastle ?
text: yesterday it was turkish billionaire biscuit king murat ülker .
today it is amanda staveley who is rumoured to be interested in buying newcastle united football club .

reuters reports that ms staveley investment firm pcp capital partners is considering making a $ 400m ( £ 303.8m ) offer for the club which was put up for sale on monday by mike ashley , the majority-owner of sports direct .
apparently , speculation about ms staveley was sparked when she was spotted watching newcastle 's match against liverpool at the beginning of this month .
either that or she 's a secret magpie .

documents.title: dow jones soars over 23,000
text: the dow jones industrial average jumped by 118.08 points in the opening minutes of trade to a new record of 23,115.52 .
the s & p 500 also touched a new high of 2,563.91 after adding 4.55 points .
the nasdaq rose by 8.95 points to 6,632.61 .

documents.title: have your say : changing shopping habits

documents.title: hurricanes hit us house construction
text: construction of new homes in the us fell in september as hurricanes harvey and irma swept the south of the country .
the us census bureau and the us department of housing and urban development says that builders broke ground on 4.7 % less homes last month compared to august .
building permits also declined by 4.5 % but completions rose by 1.1 % .
housing starts in the south fell by 15.3 % between august and september and declined 5.6 % on the same month last year .

documents.title: chicken food poisoning levels fall
text: the number of supermarket chickens contaminated with food poisoning bug campylobacter is continuing to fall , according to the food standards agency .
figures from 2016-17 showed only 6.5 % of fresh uk-produced chickens tested positive at the highest contamination level , down from 19.7 % in 2014-15 .
campylobacter is the leading cause of food poisoning in the uk and makes 280,000 people ill each year .
while 5.6 % of the affected chickens were sold by the biggest nine supermarkets , 17.1 % came from smaller retailers and butchers .

documents.title: where now for the dow ?
text: will the dow jones industrial average make it back over 23,000 on wednesday ?
it will soon become clear when the us stock markets open in less than an hour .
share prices to watch out for include amazon following the resignation of roy price , the head of its film and television arm , after being accused of sexual harassment .
investors will also have chance to react to ibm 's third quarter results , which were released on tuesday evening .
although revenue beat expectations , it was below the comparable quarter .

documents.title: the winemaker who battles temperatures as low as -25c
text: with winter temperatures regularly dipping below -25c at his vineyard , winemaker norman hardie definitely did n't chose an easy place to grow his grapes .
`` minus 25 is the absolute death knell for vitis vinifera [ the common grape vine ] , we actually have to bury our vines in the winter [ to protect them ] .
it 's a huge job , '' says the 51-year-old .
`` and then we can get snap spring frosts that can quickly ruin a crop .
we lost more than 80 % in 2015 . ''
while most of us associate winemaking with warm countries , mr hardie has since 2004 been making wine in canada .
read more here .

documents.title: flop or filip ?
text: film critic mark kermode questions whether blade runner 2049 has been a box office failure , as some reports have suggested .

documents.title: thomas cook 's palma plan
text: thomas cook is setting up a new airline in spain in a bid to cut costs in the challenging european short-haul market .
it will be based in palma de majorca and plans to start its first flights early next year with at least three airbus a320 planes .
the majorca aircraft will also be used for thomas cook 's other airlines , according to seasonal demand .
easyjet also has a seasonal base in palma , with aircraft stationed there between march and october .
thomas cook airlines has a total of 94 aircraft , flying 16.7 million passengers a year , with revenues of €2.8bn .

documents.title: wind and water
text: speaking of smart tech and all things green , scotland business editor douglas fraser tweets :

wee correction required about height - forth bridge is 110m high ?

documents.title: google 's toronto vision
text: google 's parent company is helping to plan a mixed-use development along toronto 's lake ontario waterfront .
alphabet 's sidewalk labs unit , which is developing technology to use in `` smart cities '' , said it would invest $ 50m in the project , which will create a new neighborhood called quayside .
one project is a sensor-based technology to manage crowds on a nearby street often filled with pedestrians , cyclists and motorised traffic .
sidewalk is also looking to integrate self-driving technology into the project .
read more here .

documents.title: soros gives away $ 18bn
text: george soros , the billionaire financier , is giving away nearly all of his fortune - $ 18bn to be precise - to his charitable venture , the open society foundations .

the global network of more than 100 charities supporting democracy , human rights and freedom of speech was set up in 1984 and is said to be the world 's third-largest charity after the bill and melinda gates foundation and the wellcome trust .
the name of mr soros 's organisation is derived from a book by the philosopher karl popper , the open society and its enemies - a critique of authoritarianism .

having experienced at first hand what a closed society looks like in his native hungary , mr soros 's liberal views have provoked the ire of the country 's nationalist prime minister viktor orban , particularly over issues of immigration .

documents.title: ftse helped by weaker sterling
text: the ftse 100 is up about 25 points at 7,542 , helped by a 0.15 % fall in the pound to $ 1.3170 .
the ons said uk wage growth edged above forecasts , bolstering expectations for a bank of england rate hike before the year is out .
shares in household products giant reckitt benckiser were down about 1.3 % after the firm cut its full-year sales forecast .
reckitt is struggling with fallout from a cyber attack , a failed product launch and a safety scandal in south korea .
the biggest faller on the blue-chip index is merlin entertainments , off 2.1 % after brokers cut their target prices after it reported meagre like-for-like growth yesterday .

documents.title: steel plant job hopes
text: redcar ssi site regeneration plan 'may create 20,000 jobs '
and no area deserves it more .
this could be a great part of the northern powerhouse with govt .
support .

documents.title: amazon studios boss resigns
text: amazon studios is the latest company to get dragged into the sexual predation scandal engulfing hollywood .

just days after being suspended , its boss , roy price , has resigned , following claims that he harassed a producer and ignored an actor 's allegation of sexually assault by the disgraced film producer harvey weinstein .
mr price has not commented , but mr weinstein has denied the accusation against him .
in a separate development , the brother of harvey weinstein has also been accused of sexual harassment .
bob weinstein also denied the claims .

documents.title: reality check : is it legal to tax old people more ?
text: in november , the man who holds the uk 's purse-strings will announce how the nation 's money will be spent in the year ahead .
and rumours have begun flying about potential cuts and giveaways in the pipeline .
among these , chancellor of the exchequer philip hammond is rumoured to be planning a reduced rate of national insurance , while cutting older people 's pension relief .
read more here .

documents.title: last drinks for revolution boss
text: the takeover battle for revolution bars has resulted in the departure of chief executive mark mcquater , who is leaving immediately .
keith edelman , revolution 's chairman , will become executive chairman until a suitable replacement is found .
mr edelman said : `` the business and brands have grown and developed over his four and a half year tenure as ceo and the business is well positioned for its next period of growth .
we wish him well for the future . ''
revolution said on tuesday that shareholders had rejected a £ 101m takeover bid from slug & lettuce owner stonegate .

that may leave the door open for deltic , britain 's biggest nightclub operator , which is now expected to reignite its interest in merging with revolution to create a company with annual sales of more than £ 270m .

documents.title: how the cost of living could overwhelm us
text: rent , car loans , mortgages , credit cards , pay day loans , unsecured credit , overdrafts - with real wages falling , the amount of debt we are taking on is rising and the pressure we are under is increasing .
for many , a savings cash buffer to deal with shocks and rising prices is non-existent .
when it comes to the build up of debt , this is a classic story of supply and demand .
the digitisation of financial products - making many loans little more than a mobile phone swipe away - has meant that supply has become broader and easier .
read more here .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: fiji issues green bonds
text: fiji has become the first emerging market to issue a sovereign green bond , which aims to raise $ 50m to support climate change mitigation and adaptation .
fiji 's 300 islands include low-lying atolls that are highly susceptible to cyclones and floods .
in 2016 , tro cyclone winston passed directly over fiji , causing economic losses that amounted to nearly a third of the country 's gdp .
the bonds are being issued with assistance from the world bank , and will be used on renewable energy projects and reducing fiji 's carbon emissions in the energy sector .

documents.title: wizz braces for brexit
text: wizz air , the hungary-based budget airline , is applying for an air operator 's certificate and operating licence in the uk ahead of brexit .
wizz air uk will begin operations in march 2018 if its application to the civil aviation authority is successful .
shares in wizz , which is listed in london , have soared 84 % this year to just over £ 33 , making it worth about £ 2.5bn .
that 's half the market cap of easyjet , as we mentioned earlier - not bad for a company that only floated in march 2015 .

documents.title: earnings vs mortgage payments
text: jonathan eley of the financial times makes this observation about the earnings figures out today :
but average mortgage svr in 2006 was 6.4 % , ( boe figs ) now 4.3 % = big tax cut for those who already owned home .
oil price about same
but which way for interest rates now ?
certainly ca n't fall further .
oil prices more debatable , but i 'd argue we 've seen the lows there too .
does this include public deferred pay ?
real average earnings are still £ 15 a week lower than their 2008 peak - pay no higher than it was back in february 2006
real average earnings fell by 0.4 % in three months to august .
rf projects the squeeze to deepen in coming months , before pay returns in 2018
safe as houses ?
estate agents taking the biggest hit on pay .
only finance , it , admin and the arts escaping the squeeze
total employment ticks down slightly , though the employment rate is still near a record high
good news for job quality - full-time employees are still driving year-on-year employment growth
after tax again please .
do n't just go for headlines .
now do median

documents.title: 'tough going ' for flybe
text: flybe shares are still down 15 % after warning on profits earlier in `` yet another sign that it 's tough going in the european short-haul aviation sector '' , says etx capital analyst neil wilson .
`` flybe faces the industry-wide problems that have bedevilled carriers this year ; chiefly low fares and too much capacity , '' he notes .
`` but it must also contend with an unusual legacy commitment to acquire additional aircraft , which caused capacity to increase by 12.3 % to 12.7m seats last year .
this was unwanted and it is now taking steps to reduce capacity , which should help . ''
if you have a spare £ 80m , you too could own an airline .
easyjet , by comparison , is worth £ 5bn .

documents.title: the three 'p 's
text: why does wage growth continue to disappoint ?
laith khalaf , senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown , reckons it is mainly down to `` the three 'p 's '' : productivity , public sector pay , and pensions .

`` uk productivity growth is low , which means employers are n't seeing the same output gains from workers they once did , meanwhile public sector pay has been capped in order to keep government borrowing in check , '' he says .

`` at the same time the rollout of the government 's automatic enrolment programme has seen employers forced to pay into a pension for their staff , which has no doubt diverted some money that would otherwise have flowed into pay packets . ''

documents.title: sterling struggles
text: sterling got only a temporary boost from the figures showing wage growth edging above forecasts on wednesday .
the pound hit $ 1.3218 immediately after the data , up from $ 1.3183 ahead of the release , before falling back to $ 1.3160 .

documents.title: fca raises debt concerns
text: city regulator the financial conduct authority has made a major intervention in the cost of living debate .
the fca surveyed 13,000 people about their financial lives and has exposed some serious concerns about what people think of their financial situation , and how resilient they are to bill shocks .
chief among them is levels of debt , particularly among 25 to 34-year-olds .
but the prevalence of interest-only mortgages among those in their late 40s and early 50s , and a lack of pension saving among the older generation , will also make many sit up and take notice .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: universal credit helpline charge scrapped
text: we would love to know who thought charging callers up to 55p a minute to call the government 's universal credit helpline was a good idea .
criticism from mps and campaigners has promoted welfare secretary david gauke said the helpline , would be free - although not until the end of the year .
he is being grilled this morning by the work and pensions committee about the roll-out of the much maligned universal credit .
labour wants it `` paused '' and there has been criticism about how long claimants wait to get the cash .
more here .

documents.title: 'three rises next year '
text: andrew wishart , uk economist at capital economics , says the `` decent '' set of labour market figures keeps the mpc on course for a november rate rise .

`` while headline regular pay growth ( ex-bonuses , the measure that the mpc focuses on ) fell a touch , the single month annual figure rose from 2.1 % to 2.2 % .this is only marginally lower than the mpc 's forecast for wage growth to reach 2.25 % in the fourth quarter .

as a result , we continue to think that the committee will follow through with its pledge to raise interest rates 'over the coming months ' and think that the first 25 basis point hike will come in november .
moreover , if we are right in thinking that average earnings growth will up more momentum next year , then we envisage three further hikes in 2018 . ''

documents.title: west midlands jobs boost
text: west midlands jobs boost

documents.title: back to the future
text: back to 1975 ( again ) the uk unemployment rate keeps on falling
but what is the quality of that employment ?
author: Mark Broad
Online and Today business editor

documents.title: prospects of a rate rise strengthen
text: today 's jobs figures are likely to confirm expectations that the bank of england will soon raise interest rates for the first time in a decade .
although pay growth has lagged behind inflation again , the bank has said it expects wages growth to up speed soon .
the unemployment rate is below the 4.5 % level the bank considers to be a trigger for inflation pressure in the economy .
it also thinks brexit will increase price growth in britain .

documents.title: earnings struggle
text: economics correspondent andy verity tweets :
in the 3 months june-august employment rose by 94,000 and was up 317,000 on the year .
but that did n't help earnings much - up just 2.1 %
the boe 's preferred index is average earnings+bonus ; that rose slightly to +2.2 % vs. +2.1 % exp .
the gap between cpi and earnings is at 0.8 %

documents.title: employment growth 'driven by women '
text: employment growth in the june to august was mainly down to more women in work , but earnings are failing to keep up with inflation , senior ons statistician matt hughes said .
`` many labour market measures continue to strengthen .
employment growth in the latest three-month period was driven mainly by women , with a corresponding drop in inactivity .
vacancies remain robust , at a near-record level , '' he said .
`` on the other hand , total earnings in cash terms grew slower than prices over the last year , meaning their real value continues to fall , down 0.3 % over that period . ''

documents.title: breakingwages growth slows
text: wages growth excluding bonuses slowed to 2.1 % in the three months to august - although that was slightly better than the 2 % estimated by economists .
however , average earnings including bonuses rose 2.2 % in that period .
that is the same as the revised figure for the three months to july , the ons said .

documents.title: breakingunemployment rate holds at 4.3 %
text: the uk jobless rate was 4.3 % in june to august , official figures show .
unemployment fell by 52,000 in the three months to august to 1.4 million , the ons said .

documents.title: half-term pain
text: speaking of tui , business presenter ben thompson tweets :
why are holidays more expensive at half-term ?
tui 's uk boss explains on @ twitterid
is it naked profiteering ?
i bet it 's naked profiteering .
that 's my bet .
hate this debate every year .
if , as a hotelier , you had lots of ppl booking for the same week , what would you do ?
not only that , they reduce prices in term time to get people in and keep staff employed
because they can cash in and make money out of the public ?
just guessing !
does n't take a genius to workout that it 's because of demand ?
taking that long swig of water , felt the lies were drying up his mouth when talking about half term !
they have been asking this same stupid question year after year , it is due to demand for heavens sake , there is only so much accommodation
he did n't answer did he .
and why is tui more expensive than thom cook .
& do n't say service as i have used both there is not much diff
it 's called supply and demand .
it 's the same way gifts , wrapping paper and cards are more expensive pre xmas than after it .
stagger school holidays , that 'll give @ twitterid the chance to overcharge for more weeks .
nothing they 'd like better .
spreadsheet rules !
he hit the nail on the head .
govt should stagger school holidays .
the rest we all know .
the prices would just be higher over more weeks .
would only benefit travel companies .
i dont buy that at all .
well , if you do n't buy , you 'll just need to stay at home .
no i 'll go outside term time anyway .
the sheep just stand for and pay up simple
@ twitterid would fix this
cant believe how much people moan about this - do you all get on your soapboxes about the injustice of boxing day sales ?
actually if the 1 week of half term were staggered to say 3 weeks , the holiday companies would ensure there 's 3 weeks of higher prices .
this was just free advertising for tui to make sure their name change gets across to the public because the rest is a load of bollocks
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: calling in sick
text: `` we 've seen a 1400 % increase in ( sickness ) claims since 2014 driven by claims management companies '' tui uk boss nick longman # wakeuptomoney
the claims companies should be prosecuted as well as the people making the fraudulent claims .
i 'm hardly surprised given the type of folk which travel with these brokers

documents.title: green is good ?
text: consumer journalist harry wallop tweets :
tesco to sell green satsumas .
the warm autumn in spain means they 've failed to turn orange .
me for @ twitterid
would n't that make them more likely to ripen ?
apparently not .
needs cool nights in sept , oct to turn orange .
you live and learn .
i always look for greener ones - like the tartness

documents.title: oil nudges up
text: oil prices are higher after a fall in us crude stockpiles and concerns that tensions in the middle east could disrupt supplies .
brent crude is up 0.8 % at $ 58.36 - almost a third above summer levels .
meanwhile , iraqi oil minister jabar al-luaibi has asked bp to make plans to develop the kirkuk oifields .
on monday iraqi government forces took control of the oil-rich region from kurdish forces that had occupied the area since 2014 as they clashed with so-called islamic state fighters .

documents.title: chinese whispers
text: chinese president xi jinping , has told the communist party congress that china should take centre stage in the world , and work to build a great power .
he said china 's international standing had grown during his first five years in office , but he acknowledged the country faced severe challenges .
a zero tolerance fight against party corruption would go on , mr xi added , and he vowed to strengthen china 's debt-ridden state enterprises .
so what can british business look forward to in china - a more free-wheeling market , or one subject to more centralised control ?

matthew rous , chief executive of the china-britain business council , tells today : `` everyone will be analysing the three-and-a-half hour speech very carefully to try to understand exactly the direction we 'll be going , but it is welcome that he has made a commitment to continuing to welcome foreign investment , and to opening china wider and wider to overseas business , '' he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: just chill
text: for reasons known only to us at business live towers , seachill is an immensely pleasing name for a company .
but why are we telling you this ?
well , the chilled fish processor ( just in case the clue was n't in the name ) has been gobbled up by hilton food group for £ 80.8m as the processed meat supplier enters the uk fish market .
icelandic-owned seachill is the second-biggest player in the uk fish market .

documents.title: asian stocks stall
text: stock markets across asia stalled on wednesday as investors kept an eye on the communist party congress in beijing .
the shanghai exchange rose 0.3 % to 3,381.3 points , but the shenzen exchange slipped 0.7 % to 546.5 points .
markets elsewhere were lacklustre , with hong kong 's hang seng down slightly at 28,678.8 and japan 's nikkei edging up just 0.13 % to 21,363 points .
south korea 's kospi and australia 's asx were also virtually unchanged .

documents.title: flybe shares dive
text: following flybe 's earlier warning that first-half profits would be hit by a `` disappointing '' rise in maintenance costs , its shares have plummeted more than 15 % to about 37p , valuing the company at a princely £ 80m .
gerald khoo , an analyst at liberum , downgraded flybe shares to `` hold '' from `` buy '' :
higher maintenance costs are a clear disappointment in the short term .
we assume a £ 15m hit this year , which ought to be conservative and one-off the commercial performance appears encouraging , with improvements in both yields and load factors .

however , until there is greater clarity on maintenance costs , along with further evidence of capacity cuts supporting better unit revenue trends , we believe the shares will struggle to perform . ''

documents.title: crown shares thumped
text: shares in crown resorts fell more than 4 % after it was alleged that australia 's largest casino operator tampered with slot machines and ignored evidence of drug use and domestic violence .
crown rejected claims of `` illegal and improper conduct '' at the melbourne venue .
the claims , made by three people who said they were former employees of the casino , were tabled in federal parliament .

documents.title: stuck in traffic
text: millions of pounds was wasted in fuel and time by traffic delays around the uk over the past year , according to traffic analysts inrix .
assessing the impact of disruption on motorways and a roads between september 2016 and august 2017 , it found that the worst incident in somerset cost the economy an estimated £ 2.4m .

graham cookson , chief economist at inrix , says : `` while queuing is considered a national pastime for many brits , nothing is more frustrating than sitting in traffic and it 's a costly activity . ''

documents.title: ftse higher
text: the ftse 100 has made modest gains as trading gets underway , adding 0.2 % to 7.529 points .
reckitt benckiser has slipped 2 % following that slide in sales , but foxtons is up 2.8 % .

documents.title: will rates rise ?
text: business presenter ben thompson has been talking to maike currie of fidelity international this morning :
what does 3 % inflation mean for you and is an interest rate rise now more likely ?
@ twitterid explains this morning on @ twitterid
it has to be taken in context with the 16 % wage cut i got last month ( same hours etc ) .
'strong and stable ' ?
tories have screwed us
totally screwed us
it 's myth 2 % inflation is necessary for a healthy economy but no economist dare say so for fear of being out of a job .
wages never go up even 1 % , the the gap for living is massive !
nightmare because my husband has n't had a pay rise for 10 years
reported about `` pensioners `` getting all this money compared to youngsters , no one ever mentions that not all pensioners get full pension
ffs it means stop wasting money on £ 120 trainers and £ 70 handbags just do n't buy tat all the time and save your money
constant austerity chat gave & still gives management the power to drive down wages , constant drivel of we need to be more efficient kills pay
means nothing to me
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: foxtons struggles
text: foxtons , the estate agent some people love to hate , says third-quarter revenue fell 6.4 % as sales commissions drooped £ 2m to £ 10.3m .
group revenue fell to £ 2.4m to £ 35.1m compared with the same period last year , while lettings revenues were stable at £ 22.5m .
the company , which floated in late 2013 , hopes to profitability by targeting higher-volume , higher-value residential property markets in london .
shares in foxtons have fallen 28 % this year .

documents.title: pension rise 'fair enough ' : ifs
text: in terms of inflation , pensioners are not doing that badly compared with people who are in work or on benefits , says paul johnson , who runs the institute for fiscal studies .

`` pensioners have been doing better than everybody else , pensions have been going up more than everything else , but this year is a year you think , fair enough , pensions are just going up with prices , '' he says .
`` the problem is , for most people in work , their earnings are n't going up in line with prices .
and for those in working age on benefits , their benefits are n't going up at all . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: secret shopper snoopers
text: business presenter susannah streeter tweets :
mps became secret shopper snoopers to uncover vat fraud by overseas sellers , which puts uk firms out of business
scared mps seeking a windmill to charge too many don quixotes in parliament need som action not yah booing at each other

documents.title: shell director stands down
text: guy elliott , the former chief financial officer of rio tinto , has stood down as a director of shell after the mining company , as well as himself and former rio chief executive tom albanese , was accused of fraud by the us securities and exchange commission .

shell chair charles holliday said : `` we fully respect and appreciate guy 's decision we sincerely hope he satisfactorily resolves those proceedings and , that in that event , he would like to be considered for rejoining the board . ''

documents.title: barker to chair deripaska 's en+
text: greg barker , who was energy minister under david cameron , has a new job : chairing oleg deripaska 's en+ .
the russian aluminium to hydroelectric power group is in the process of listing in moscow and london and the appointment is intended to address investors ' corporate governance fears .
the appointment of mr barker - who is also a life peer - expands the board to nine directors , two of whom are independent .
en+ said another independent director will be appointed after the ipo and the board expanded to 13 directors , six of whom will not be appointed by the majority shareholder .

documents.title: flybe profits lose altitude
text: flybe warns that first half profit will be lower than expected following a `` disappointing '' rise in maintenance costs .
adjusted pre-tax profit will now be between £ 5m and £ 10m , compared with £ 15.9m in the same period last year .

chief executive christine ourmieres-widener says : `` while half-year profits are lower than expected , i am confident that we are still on a clear sustainable path to profitability in line with our stated plan . ''

documents.title: reckitt reorganises
text: reckitt benckiser plans to reorganise its business into two units - one for health and the other for hygiene and home products - in a bid to revive its sagging growth .

the maker of durex condoms , nurofen tablets and dettol cleaners reported its weakest quarter in july , following a series of issues including a collapse of its south korean business after a safety scandal , a failed product launch and a cyber attack .
the decision follows the june acquisition of us baby formula maker mead johnson , which will account for about half the health unit 's sales .
chief executive rakesh kapoor ( will run the health unit , while europe and north america boss rob de groot will be in charge of the health and hygiene business .
reckitt said revenues fell 1 % in the three months to september to £ 3.2bn .
